subject: AI & Agents
title: The Black Box Problem
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Black Box Problem.

hook.text: An AI denies your loan. You ask why. Nobody â€” not even the developers â€” can give you a clear answer.

buildup.text: Deep neural networks process data through millions of interconnected parameters.

discovery.text: The network's reasoning is distributed across all those parameters. No single part holds the 'reason.'

twist.text: Explainable AI (XAI) research creates approximations, but true transparency remains elusive.

climax.text: The EU's AI Act now requires explanations for high-stakes AI decisions. The technology isn't fully ready.

punchline.text: A decision without an explanation isn't accountability. It's authority.

quiz.question: Why is the 'black box' problem concerning for AI decisions?
options: Nobody can clearly explain why the AI made a specific decision
The physical hardware is literally painted black
